Job Title: Data & Analytics Financial Consolidation

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Finance

Description:
The Aerospace Data & Analytics Financial Consolidation will work closely with the Aerospace Consolidation and Financial Systems leader to ensure integrity of the Total Aerospace financial close processes, managing all financial systems that support the financial closing activities and ensure external and internal requirements are met.Work with Aerospace Finance DT team on strategic initiatives related to financial systems. Interact with Aerospace & Holdings business units, FP&A, Treasury, and Tax to ensure the close is completed in a timely, complete, and accurate manner. Use Lean to continuously improve closing and systems processes. 
Job Description:with master data governance team to maintain the configurations for financial close and consolidation systems across both Aerospace and Holdings to ensure accurate results.to prepare, review and validate the core balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement for use in the 10Q/10K filings.to analyze/understand the core balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement.to understand financial consolidation and systems implications of new accounting pronouncements or organizational realignments.a robust understanding of how intercompany eliminations work.Specifically in Hyperion Financial Management (HFM).to understand how to perform recasts of financial datato create/maintain robust SOx controls around the accurate flow of data between various financial systems including ERPs and Close/Consolidation systems that feed financial reporting.to build/manage processes for financial controls.Referred to as the edit process at GE.with business units and cross-functional teams on internal and external reporting activities, variance analysis, and associated projects.financial system rationalization and integration across Aerospace, Holdings and RASRsimplification projects by using Lean.external audit requests in a timely manner
Qualifications/Requirements:or Master's degree or equivalent knowledge or experience in Finance, Accounting, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.with close and consolidation processes in a large multinational organization and related financial systems.of generally accepted accounting principles.expertise in close and consolidation processes at a public company along with related financial systems.expertise in chart of accounts design and maintenance.

Desired Characteristics:to analyze financial and operational data and draw conclusions.to prioritize multiple concurrent projects and work effectively under strict time constraints.interpersonal skills: ability to effectively interact with stakeholders.and experience with contemporary financial systems (e.g., Oracle Fusion, Oracle EBS, SAP, Hyperion Planning, HFM, DRM).organizational skills.PC skills - specifically Excel and PowerPoint.to detail.respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn.shares critical information, speaks with candor, contributes constructively.quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed.communicator, decision-maker, collaborative.solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

job_responsibilities: Work closely with the Aerospace Consolidation and Financial Systems leader to ensure integrity of the Total Aerospace financial close processes.
Manage all financial systems that support the financial closing activities.
Ensure external and internal requirements are met.
Work with Aerospace Finance DT team on strategic initiatives related to financial systems.
Interact with Aerospace & Holdings business units, FP&A, Treasury, and Tax.
Ensure the close is completed in a timely, complete, and accurate manner.
Use Lean to continuously improve closing and systems processes.
Maintain configurations for financial close and consolidation systems across both Aerospace and Holdings.
Prepare, review, and validate the core balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement for use in the 10Q/10K filings.
Analyze/understand the core balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement.
Understand financial consolidation and systems implications of new accounting pronouncements or organizational realignments.
Specifically in Hyperion Financial Management (HFM).
Understand how to perform recasts of financial data.
Create/maintain robust SOx controls around the accurate flow of data between various financial systems.
Build/manage processes for financial controls.
Contribute to the edit process at GE.
Work with business units and cross-functional teams on internal and external reporting activities, variance analysis, and associated projects.
Financial system rationalization and integration across Aerospace, Holdings, and RAS.
Simplification projects by using Lean.
Respond to external audit requests in a timely manner.
